sub_topic: Finding the determinant of a matrix
message_1:
What is the determinant of the following 3x3 matrix:
$$\begin{bmatrix} 2 & -3 & 1 \\ 0 & 4 & -2 \\ -1 & 0 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$$
message_2:
To find the determinant of a 3x3 matrix, we can use the following formula:

$$\det(A) = a(ei - fh) - b(di - fg) + c(dh - eg)$$

where the matrix A is:

$$\begin{bmatrix} a & b & c \\ d & e & f \\ g & h & i \end{bmatrix}$$

In our case, the matrix is:

$$\begin{bmatrix} 2 & -3 & 1 \\ 0 & 4 & -2 \\ -1 & 0 & 3 \end{bmatrix}$$

So, we have:

$$a = 2, b = -3, c = 1$$
$$d = 0, e = 4, f = -2$$
$$g = -1, h = 0, i = 3$$

Now, we can plug these values into the formula:

$$\det(A) = 2(4\cdot3 - (-2)\cdot0) - (-3)(0\cdot3 - (-2)\cdot(-1)) + 1(0\cdot0 - 4\cdot(-1))$$

$$\det(A) = 2(12 - 0) - (-3)(0 - 2) + 1(0 - (-4))$$

$$\det(A) = 2(12) + 3(2) + 1(4)$$

$$\det(A) = 24 + 6 + 4$$

$$\det(A) = 34$$

So, the determinant of the given 3x3 matrix is 34.
